content: The "Federal Employee Retirement Contributions Act of 1999" amends the Civil Service Retirement System by changing the table under section 8334(c) of title 5, United States Code. The amendments include adjustments to employee contributions and deposits. The "Federal Employee Retirement Contributions Act of 1999" amends the Civil Service Retirement System by adjusting employee contributions and deposits. The changes include new dates for contribution rates: 7.5% after December 31, 1999, and 8% after December 31, 1999. The "Federal Employee Retirement Contributions Act of 1999" adjusts contribution rates for law enforcement officers, firefighters, and bankruptcy judges. The new rates are 7.5% after December 31, 1999. The contribution rates for bankruptcy judges and judges of the United States Court of Appeals for the Armed Forces are adjusted to 7.5% after December 31, 1999. SEC. 3 amends the percentages of basic pay for military service and readjustment allowance for volunteer service performed during 1999. SEC. 4 addresses other federal retirement systems. Amendment to the Central Intelligence Agency Retirement and Disability System regarding deductions, withholdings, and deposits for employees participating in the system. Military service provisions are also adjusted. The amendment to the Central Intelligence Agency Retirement and Disability System allows participants with military service to pay a percentage of basic pay for each period of service. Additionally, adjustments are made to the Foreign Service Retirement and Disability System. Beginning on January 1, 1999, through December 31, 1999, participants in the Foreign Service Retirement and Disability System will have 7.25 percent withheld from their basic pay. This also applies to eligible Foreign Service criminal investigators/inspectors of the Office of the Inspector General, Agency for International Development. Participants in the Foreign Service Retirement and Disability System will have 7.75 percent withheld from their basic pay starting January 1, 1999. A conforming amendment was made to the Foreign Service Act of 1980. The applicable percentage for the Foreign Service Pension System ranges from 7.5% before January 1, 1999, to 7.75% from January 1, 1999, to December 31, 1999, and back to 7.5% after December 31, 1999. The Foreign Service Act of 1980 is amended to set the amount to be paid for volunteer service at 3.25 percent from January 1, 1999, through December 31, 1999. This Act and its amendments will take effect on December 31, 1999.
